intro: Amylotheca francii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters, with leaves that are velvety and often colored in shades of green, purple, or silver. Amylotheca francii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
